text: They moved from Pi Hahiroth and went through the middle of the sea into the desert. After they traveled for three days in the Desert of Etham, they set up camp at Marah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Marah and came to Elim. Elim had 12 springs and 70 palm trees, so they set up camp there.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Elim and set up camp by the Red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from the Red Sea and set up camp in the Desert of Sin.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from the Desert of Sin and set up camp at Dophkah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Dophkah and set up camp at Alush.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Alush and set up camp at Rephidim, where there was no water for the people to drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Rephidim and set up camp in the Desert of Sinai.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from the Desert of Sinai and set up camp at Kibroth Hattaavah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Kibroth Hattaavah and set up camp at Hazeroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Hazeroth and set up camp at Rithmah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Rithmah and set up camp at Rimmon Perez.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Rimmon Perez and set up camp at Libnah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Libnah and set up camp at Rissah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Rissah and set up camp at Kehelathah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Kehelathah and set up camp at Mount Shepher.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Mount Shepher and set up camp at Haradah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Haradah and set up camp at Makheloth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Makheloth and set up camp at Tahath.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Tahath and set up camp at Terah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Terah and set up camp at Mithcah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Mithcah and set up camp at Hashmonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Hashmonah and set up camp at Moseroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Moseroth and set up camp at Bene Jaakan.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Bene Jaakan and set up camp at Hor Haggidgad.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Hor Haggidgad and set up camp at Jotbathah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Jotbathah and set up camp at Abronah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Abronah and set up camp at Ezion Geber.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Ezion Geber and set up camp at Kadesh in the Desert of Zin.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Kadesh and set up camp at Mount Hor on the border of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text: At Yahweh’s command the priest Aaron went up on Mount Hor. He died there on the first day of the fifth month in the fortieth year after the Israelites had left Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Aaron was 123 years old when he died on Mount Hor.
speaker: Narrator

text: (The Canaanite king of Arad, who lived in the Negev, which was in Canaan, heard that the Israelites were coming.)
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Mount Hor and set up camp at Zalmonah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Zalmonah and set up camp at Punon.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Punon and set up camp at Oboth.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Oboth and set up camp at Iye Abarim on the border of Moab.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Iyim and set up camp at Dibon Gad.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Dibon Gad and set up camp at Almon Diblathaim.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from Almon Diblathaim and set up camp in the Abarim Mountains east of Nebo.
speaker: Narrator

text: They moved from the Abarim Mountains and set up camp on the plains of Moab near the Jordan River across from Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set up camp on the plains of Moab along the Jordan. Their camp extended from Beth Jeshimoth to Abel Shittim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh said to Moses on the plains of Moab near the Jordan River across from Jericho,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Tell the Israelites, ‘You will be crossing the Jordan River and entering Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: As you advance, force out all the people who live there. Get rid of all their stone and metal idols, and destroy all their places of worship.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take possession of the land and live there, because I will give it to you for your own.
speaker: Narrator

text: Divide the land among your families by drawing lots. Give more land to larger families and less land to smaller ones. The land must be given to each family by drawing lots. Divide it among your ancestors’ tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: “‘But if you do not force out those who live in the land, they will be like splinters in your eyes and thorns in your sides. They will constantly fight with you over the land you live in.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then I will do to you what I planned to do to them.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh said to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Give the Israelites these instructions. When you enter Canaan, the land that will be given to you as your inheritance has these borders:
speaker: Narrator

text: “The southern side includes part of the Desert of Zin along the border of Edom. In the east the southern border starts from the end of the Dead Sea
speaker: Narrator

text: and turns south of the Akrabbim Pass. It then goes past Zin and ends at Kadesh Barnea. From there it goes to Hazar Addar and on to Azmon.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Azmon it turns toward the River of Egypt so that the border ends at the Mediterranean Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The western border is the coastline of the Mediterranean Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The northern border extends from the Mediterranean Sea to Mount Hor,
speaker: Narrator

text: and from Mount Hor to the border of Hamath so that it ends at Zedad.
speaker: Narrator

text: From there the border goes to Ziphron and ends at Hazar Enan.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The eastern border extends from Hazar Enan to Shepham.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Shepham the border goes down to Riblah, east of Ain, and continues along the eastern slope of the Sea of Galilee.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the border goes along the Jordan River so that it ends at the Dead Sea.
“This will be your land and the borders around it.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses commanded the Israelites, “This is the land you will divide by drawing lots. Yahweh has commanded that this land will be given to the nine-and-a-half tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: The households from the tribes of Reuben, Gad, and half of the tribe of Manasseh have already received their land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Those two-and-a-half tribes received land east of the Jordan River across from Jericho.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh said to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: “These are the names of the men who will divide the land for you: the priest Eleazar and Joshua, son of Nun.
speaker: Narrator

text: You must also take one leader from each tribe to divide the land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
These are their names:
Caleb, son of Jephunneh, from the tribe of Judah;
speaker: Narrator

text: Shemuel, son of Ammihud, from the tribe of Simeon;
speaker: Narrator

text: Elidad, son of Kislon, from the tribe of Benjamin;
speaker: Narrator

text: Bukki, son of Jogli, the leader of the tribe of Dan;
speaker: Narrator

text: Hanniel, son of Ephod, the leader of the tribe of Manasseh;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Kemuel, son of Shiphtan, the leader of the tribe of Ephraim;
(Manasseh and Ephraim are Joseph’s descendants.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Elizaphan, son of Parnach, the leader of the tribe of Zebulun;
speaker: Narrator

text: Paltiel, son of Azzan, the leader of the tribe of Issachar;
speaker: Narrator

text: Ahihud, son of Shelomi, the leader of the tribe of Asher;
speaker: Narrator

text: Pedahel, son of Ammihud, the leader of the tribe of Naphtali.”
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the men Yahweh commanded to divide Canaan for the Israelites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh spoke to Moses on the plains of Moab near the Jordan River across from Jericho. He said,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Tell the Israelites to give the Levites some cities from their own property. They must also give the Levites the pastureland around those cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Levites will have cities to live in and pastureland for their cattle, the flocks they own, and any other animals they have.
speaker: Narrator

text: “The land around the cities that you give the Levites will extend 1,500 feet from the city wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: Outside the city measure off 3,000 feet on the east side, 3,000 feet on the south side, 3,000 feet on the west side, and 3,000 feet on the north side, with the city in the center. This will be their pastureland around the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Six of the cities you give the Levites will be cities of refuge. You must allow murderers to escape to these cities. In addition, you must also give the Levites 42 other cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: So you will give a total of 48 cities with pastureland to the Levites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cities you give the Levites from the property of the other Israelites must be given based on the amount of land each tribe owns. Take more cities from larger tribes and fewer from smaller tribes.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yahweh said to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Tell the Israelites: When you cross the Jordan River and enter Canaan,
speaker: Narrator

text: select certain cities to be places of refuge. Anyone who unintentionally kills another person may run to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: These cities will be places of refuge from any relative who can avenge the death. So anyone accused of murder will not have to die until he has had a trial in front of the community.
speaker: Narrator

text: There will be six cities you select as places of refuge,
speaker: Narrator

text: three on the east side of the Jordan River and three in Canaan.
speaker: Narrator

text: These six cities will be places of refuge for Israelites, foreigners, and strangers among you. Anyone who unintentionally kills another person may flee to these cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But if any of you uses an iron weapon to kill another person, you are a murderer. Murderers must be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any of you picks up a stone as a weapon and uses it to kill another person, you are a murderer. Murderers must be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or if any of you picks up a piece of wood as a weapon and uses it to kill another person, you are a murderer. Murderers must be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: The relative who can avenge the death must make sure a murderer is put to death. When he catches up with the murderer, he must kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: If any of you kills someone you hate by shoving him or by deliberately throwing something at him,
speaker: Narrator

text: or if you beat your enemy to death with your bare hands, you must be put to death. You are a murderer. The relative who can avenge the death must kill you when he catches up with you, because you are a murderer.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But suppose you accidentally kill someone who wasn’t your enemy. Maybe you shoved him or threw something at him but didn’t mean to kill him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Or suppose you drop a big stone, and someone is killed. However, you didn’t know the person was there, he wasn’t your enemy, and you weren’t trying to harm him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the community must use these rules in order to decide if you are innocent or if the dead person’s relative can avenge the death.
speaker: Narrator

text: If you are innocent, the community must protect you from that relative. They must take you back to the city of refuge you fled to. You must live there until the death of the high priest who was anointed with the holy oil.
speaker: Narrator

text: “But don’t go outside the city of refuge you fled to.
speaker: Narrator

text: If the relative who can avenge the death finds you outside the city of refuge and kills you, the relative is not guilty of murder.
speaker: Narrator

text: Accused murderers must stay in their city of refuge until the death of the high priest. They may go back to their own property only after his death.
speaker: Narrator

text: “These will be the rules for future generations wherever you live.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Whoever kills another person will be put to death as a murderer only on the testimony of more than one witness. No one can be put to death on the testimony of only one witness.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Never accept a cash payment in exchange for the life of a convicted murderer who has been given the death penalty. Murderers must be put to death.
speaker: Narrator

text: “An accused murderer who has fled to a city of refuge must never go back and live on his own land before the death of the high priest. Don’t accept a cash payment to allow him to do this.
speaker: Narrator

text: “You must not pollute the land where you live. Murder is what pollutes the land. The land where a murder was committed can never make peace with the Lord except through the death of the murderer.
speaker: Narrator

text: Never make the land where you and I live unclean. I, Yahweh, live among the Israelites.”
speaker: Narrator

text: The heads of the households whose families were descended from Gilead, son of Machir and grandson of Manasseh, (families of Joseph’s descendants) came and spoke to Moses and the leaders of the other Israelite households.
speaker: Narrator

text: They said, “Sir, Yahweh commanded you to give the Israelites their land by drawing lots. Yahweh also commanded you to give the land of our relative Zelophehad to his daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text: Suppose they marry men from the other tribes of Israel. Their land will be taken away from that of our ancestors and added to the land of the tribe they marry into. Then we will have lost part of our land.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the Israelites’ jubilee year comes, their land will be added to that of the tribe they married into. Then part of the land of our ancestors’ tribe will be gone.”
speaker: Narrator

text: So Moses gave the Israelites a command from Yahweh. “The tribe of Joseph’s descendants is right.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what Yahweh commands for Zelophehad’s daughters: They may marry anyone they want to, but only within a family of their ancestor’s tribe.
speaker: Narrator

text: In this way no land of the Israelites will pass from one tribe to another. Every Israelite must keep the tribal land inherited from his ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: A woman who inherits land in any of the tribes of Israel may marry a man from any family in her ancestor’s tribe. In this way every Israelite keeps the land inherited from his ancestors.
speaker: Narrator

text: No land may pass from one tribe to another. Each Israelite tribe must keep the land it inherits.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Zelophehad’s daughters did as Yahweh commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Mahlah, Tirzah, Hoglah, Milcah, and Noah married their cousins on their father’s side of the family.
speaker: Narrator

text: They married within the families of the descendants of Manasseh, son of Joseph. So their land stayed in the tribe of their father’s family.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the commands and rules Yahweh gave the Israelites through Moses on the plains of Moab near the Jordan River across from Jericho.
speaker: Narrator
